CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. 18, reads: "Ammon Sports Award Night - More than 200 persons crowded into the Terrace Room of the Terrace Hall Hotel, last week, to celebrate the fourth annual Award Night, sponsored by the Ammon Center Recreation League.  Beautiful trophies were given to the winning team and players in the Ammon Recreation Slow Pitch League.  In the left photo, left to right, are: Constable Tommy Smith, vigorous opponent of juvenile delinquency and the most generous contributor to this Award Night, both financially and in all-around interest, and Frank (Fuzzy) Walton, manager, hold the second place trophy won by the Tommy Smith All-Stars in the league playoffs (the All-Stars previously won the league championship); while Kay Rainey, manager, and 'Jim' Weaver covet the first-place trophy won by the Parker A. C. in the playoffs..."
TitMainTitle: Jim Weaver and Constable Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith seated behind table with softball trophy, with members of Tommy Smith All Star softball team in background, at Ammon Center award night, Terrace Hall Hotel
